title: Quantifying Accuracy of an Event-Based Star Tracker via Earth's Rotation
summary: This paper analyzes the accuracy of an event-based camera (EBC) star tracking system by utilizing Earth's motion as ground truth. It focuses on detecting and tracking events (stars) in space and time, which is relevant to spatio-temporal analysis and potentially point processes.
usefulness_reason: Score 60 assigned because the paper discusses "Event-based cameras" and "star tracking", which involves detecting events in space and time, making it relevant to "Spatio Temporal". The "event-based" nature also suggests a connection to "Point Process" concepts.
